doc.title: Shenzhen SC New Energy (A)
doc.source_uri: 25.9月 普通个人版/9.1 普通个人版/BofA/Shenzhen SC New Energy A 2Q25 earnings in line see slower revenue recognition in 2H reiterate UnderperformShenzhen SC Ne_2025-08-28

processing_metadata.publication: 25.9月 普通个人版/9.1 普通个人版/BofA
processing_metadata.input_relative_path: 25.9月 普通个人版/9.1 普通个人版/BofA

passages.text: Reiterate Rating: UNDERPERFORM | PO: 60.00 CNY | Price: 84.28 CNY

SC New Energy announced 2Q25 results on 27 August. Revenue came in RMB4.3bn, up \(6\%\) YoY/4% QoQ, \(9\%\) below our forecast. The growth in 2Q25 was mainly supported by accelerated revenue recognition in its PV equipment, thanks to the rush installation of solar projects before end- May. Operating income rose \(20\%\) YoY/31% QoQ to RMB1.1bn, \(9\%\) above our forecast, thanks to improving GPM of its PV equipment. Net income in 2Q25 was RMB1.1bn, up \(73\%\) YoY/58% QoQ, at the midpoint of preliminary earnings range (RMB992- 1,252mn, up \(53 - 93\%\) YoY) and above our forecast, mainly on lesser- than- expected asset and credit impairment during the period.

In 1H25, revenue from PV equipment and automation equipment amounted to RMB7.0/1.0bn, \(+29\%\) /15% YoY. As of end- 2Q25, its contract liability balance stood at RMB9.7bn, down \(48\%\) YoY/20% QoQ, indicating a major decline in its order on hand after an accelerated revenue recognition in 2Q25. In 1H25, its overseas revenue amounted to RMB2.0bn, \(+363\%\) YoY, and accounted for \(25\%\) of its total revenue (vs. \(6\%\) in 1H24). Its overseas order value in 1H25 was around RMB1.5bn, and management expects more than RMB4bn overseas order in full- year 2025.

We factor in SC New Energy's 2Q25 results, and lower our 2025/26/27E revenue forecast by \(7\% /7\% /10\%\) , as we expect its revenue recognition to slow down after the rush installation in 2Q25. On the other hand, we lift our 2025/26/27E earnings forecast by \(8\% /7\% /1\%\) , mainly on higher GPM but lower asset & credit- impairment forecast. We raise our DCF- based PO to RMB60 (was RMB54) using a post- tax WACC of \(14.5\%\) (was \(14.4\%\) , as we update its capital structure), and higher free cash flow forecasts in 2025- 35E. However, we reiterate our Underperform rating as we expect the declining capex in the solar sector to weigh on its near- term earnings growth.
\\* For full definitions of \(\sqrt{\mathrm{method}}^{\mathrm{th}}\) measures, see page 7.
>> Employed by a non- US affiliate of BofAS and is not registered/qualified as a research analyst under the FINRA rules.
Refer to "Other Important Disclosures" for information on certain BofA Securities entities that take responsibility for the information herein in particular jurisdictions.

BofA Securities does and seeks to do business with issuers covered in its research reports. As a result, investors should be aware that the firm may have a conflict of interest that could affect the objectivity of this report. Investors should consider this report as only a single factor in making their investment decision.
Refer to important disclosures on page 8 to 10. Analyst Certification on page 5. Price Objective Basis/Risk on page 5.

Industrials/Multi- Industry
SC New Energy is one of China's leading solar cell equipment suppliers with \(>50\%\) market share in PERC technology and \(
Exhibit 1:2Q25 results comparison 2Q25 earnings grew \(73\%\) YoY
Source: BofA Global Research estimates, company report
Exhibit 2:New vs.old estimates We raise 2025/26/27E earnings by \(8\% /7\% /1\%\)
Source: BofA Global Research estimates
Exhibit 3:Quarterly P&L summary
Source: BofA Global Research estimates, company report

Our DCF- based PO of RMB60 is derived using a post- tax WACC of \(14.5\%\) , a terminal growth rate of \(3\%\) . This implies a \(7 \times 2025E\) P/E, lower than its average P/E since listing, reflecting our gloomy outlook on its orders growth after 2025E amid the TOPCon capex downturn.
Upside risks: (1) higher- than- expected market share gain in HJT technology, (2) breakthrough of Perovskite technology, (3) breakthrough of bifacial Poly.

Downside risks: (1) weaker end- demand for solar panels, (2) unsatisfactory yield rate of PE- Poly, (3) intensifying competition, (4) breakthrough of HJT leading to lower- than- expected TOPCon capex.
